paper_abstract: We are interested in the solution of non-conservative hyperbolic systems. and consider in particular the so-called path-conservative schemes (see e.g. [2,3]) which rely on the theoretical work in [1]. The example of the standard Euler equations for a perfect gas is used to illuminate some computational issues and shortcomings of this approach. (C) 2009 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A comment on the computation of non-conservative products
